mbABnlSmiR8D66JEEzoPAQ.text: First time to Coughlin's Law tonight. My fiance and I checked in via the Yelp app and were seated shortly after we arrived. While we waited we got a beer at the bar and were served promptly. Once we were seated on the back patio Olivia quickly introduced herself and reviewed the specials with us. She was attentive and personable throughout the night, even while dealing with two 25 tops back to back in the dining room. She and the other server on the patio, Cheyenne, took turns checking on each other's tables. In addition, the food was delicious and they have a great beer list full of locals. Olivia did such a great job that we stopped to check in with the manager on our way out. Great food, even better service. We will be back!

ej2rJDcM2eN1yYHz_wUFKw.text: Last evening we had a work dinner and heard about this new place on Mount Washington. The three of us went hoping we could sit on the patio with the killer view of the city. We only had to wait a few minutes for a spot there, and the waitress came along quickly. We never got her name but she had a blunt cut blonde hair above her shoulders and dark framed glasses with forearm tattoos - she was awesome. She got us drinks and they beer selection was great. We had the blossoms and lollipop bacon for appetizers. Super tasty. I ordered the Coughlin's burger and asked for it well (sorry, I hate pink). It came out perfectly. My two colleagues also loved their meals. We spent about three hours there hanging out, making jokes with the waitress, spending money on more drinks, and just having a really great time. I'll be back for sure.

T-X7z7LcX3PPPI-GsyA9dg.text: Went for brunch and everything fell short.   Bloody Mary's came out with the meal and didn't have everything I ordered.  I order the basic breakfast with eggs and cheese, Biscuits and bacon.  The eggs were cold with no cheese and the bacon was terrible.  The biscuit was undercooked and doughy.  Avocado toast was not toasted and cilantro was way to much.  If it weren't for the service I would not come back.

E6yu7Ko-f9Zw3TNUwOmZdA.text: Decent selection of beer and available in small sizes so you can taste several.  The atmosphere is very nice opening to an outdoor area in nice weather. This is a good place to go to grab a beer with a friend or group of friends. The reason it only gets 3 stars is that the food is a bit lackluster. It's not bad, it's just not worth going out of your way to eat here.  If I was rating it purely as a bar and not a restaurant, I'd rate it a bit higher.

IlzOMmIO_ATCC-FKne-4rg.text: Went here for happy hour since I live right down the street, there was not more than 10 people there and the bartender was incredibly slow and just hanging out with coworkers instead of working. But. The drinks and food are great. Staff just needs some managing.

PKoibIhGzjDsst-9PzfcjQ.text: I was very happy to get a great table on the front porch with my 2 friends.  The atmosphere was friendly and our food was delicious.  I had the vegan burger and cucumber salad, my friends had the paparedelle (pasta) with shrimp and they both liked it.  Our drinks were well done and too.  The only thing, and I hate to say anything negative because I live here and the place has been packed every day and night so far; (I think my niece and her friends are already regulars there) but the "Seasonal" dessert was the worst thing I've ever paid for.  We told our waitress and showed her the hard Brownie served with melted ice cream (called an ice cream sandwich).  Evidently she didn't know how to handle it, so  she just went ahead and charged us  for them. We let it go cause it was so cheap.  I  won't go into detail, I just hope the manager comes up with a replacement that is edible before we get too far into the Season!  Wishing you continued success!

Qj2Odo3PNyFWq8RflZzb0Q.text: I have such a hard time rating this place. The atmosphere that they have created is awesome. I will meet my friends for drinks here any day of the week. The food on the other hand is horrendous. I have gotten the Cuban, which came out with chewy pork meat. Gag me now. The pretzel sticks that were still cold. I came back again cause I thought oh it just opened. Nope. The buffalo chicken dip is just mind blowing-ly bad. I mean it had a brick of yogurt in it?(idk if it is yogurt but that's what it tasted like) and I feel like it is hard to mess up buffalo chicken BUT silver lining. The beer and cocktail menu are top notch. I just will recommend stopping in for happy hour drinks or late night after dinner.

fHuS8E1a4Vl_h8yJbaxDgA.text: This place looks okay from the outside but don't judge a book by its cover. It has the worst service of all time. Seriously-I give this place chance after chance and they always disappoint. The management is a disgrace too. We had a waitress who literally looked like she had the flu and it was an inconvenience that we were there. And then they have this guy "joe" at the door...dear God. This place just needs to work on basics. Just drive a few blocks to Bingham Tavern...you will be much happier.

ByB3lOTBQUn60Lv5XrjZrQ.text: I wanted to like this place so badly but the food is terrible. My friends and I went for breakfast and we were so disappointed. My friend ordered the blue corn waffle which includes an egg on top. She asked for it to be cooked more than sunny side up as the menu lists. The waiter came out to our table after our food was brought out and apologized. He said he asked the cook for an over easy egg but the cook doesn't like any alterations to his menu. My friend was the one eating the egg not the cook. She wasn't asking for any substitutions she just wanted the egg cooked longer so the yolk didn't run. My breakfast potatoes were dry as hell. Bacon was over cooked. Everything lacked flavor. Drinks are too sweet and overpriced. Service was a joke.

1WNAViOXkHJH0bdJqjM09g.text: I may be a little biased, considering I share the name of the restaurant, but this place epitomizes the perfect neighborhood bar.  The food was great, the beer list robust, the service amazing, and the layout was open and comfortable.  The view of Downtown Pittsburg was spectacular, and they even have cornhole.  The cocktail list was, as it should be, creative and well executed.  Coughlin would be proud, God rest his soul.

XxWPzd2-WRqS4UuLduaD8A.text: If I could give a ZERO I would!  We sat on the patio for brunch (we actually attempted).  After waiting over 15 minutes of having no one come over we finally left!  They were not overly busy, and the only thing we got was water given to us by the hostess!  The waitress asked the people behind me if they needed anything else, they said just the check and then she left!  No, "I'll be right back or just another minute, NOTHING!"  Needless to say, we left...aggravated and hungry!  I guess we didn't look hungry enough or just not like the type to be there to be totally ignored like that!  Plus, a lot of the waitresses were inside joking and laughing and not being very attentive to anything but each other!  I will never go there again!

nLgns7fmZuK_HJJvIllZ8g.text: Headline / TL;DR version - I recommend you go here for the vibe and drinks, especially when you can take advantage of the front and back patios.  Go somewhere else for food.  Ambiance - 4.25/5 Drinks - 4/5 Food - 2/5 Service 3.5/5 Value - 3/5 (4/5 during Happy Hour)  As a resident of Mount Washington, I can say that Coughlin's Law is a welcomed and complementary addition to the neighborhood's restaurant & bar scene.  Overall, the owners did a really nice job with the concept, especially with the open layout that leverages two outdoor spaces - the large front patio and the smaller back patio that overlooks a piece of the Pittsburgh skyline.  The ambiance is probably my favorite part of Coughlin's Law, and something that is unique enough that it alone will bring me back.  I like their drink menu as well.  It's beer forward; Coughlin's Law has more draft selections than anywhere in Mt. Washington and they do a good job of keeping their website up to date.  However, my first drink was not a beer, it was a Maple Bacon Old Fashioned to take advantage of their $6 cocktail special during Happy Hour.  It passed the test!  The drink had the right amount of maple / walnut flavor (it was still whiskey forward) and came with a very good maple bacon "lollipop" on a toothpick.  You can't go wrong with this drink, and this is coming from someone whose favorite drink is an Old Fashioned and expects greatness when I order one.  Sadly, the bacon lollipop was BY FAR the best food item I had.  To sum up my opinion of the food, I think the intentions are good but the ingredients and execution are not.  My friend and I started with the Chips & Beer Cheese ($7, but $5 during HH), and when the chips are better than the dip, you know you're in trouble.  The beer cheese just lacked flavor.    For my entree, I ordered the Crispy Chicken BLT , and when it came out, it looked great.  However, the batter was very thick & saturated in oil and the chicken was remarkably thin, so it was mostly a batter sandwich.  The romaine lettuce garnish was all stalk and no leaf, and I took most of it off my sandwich.  Finally, the arugula pesto was good but barely there, and more was really needed to add some depth to the sandwich.   The service was as expected and checked the box.  It took a few minutes to be greeted but the hostess was friendly and accommodating.  The server was prompt, attentive, and friendly as well.  Overall, I'm happy that Coughlin's Law is open and will be a regular visitor.  For now though, it will just be for drinks.

aUwkP3YCYuuo82UOGzWG2w.text: A much needed and welcome addition to Mount Washington. Be sure to check it out if you are in the area.  My husband and I went early last Saturday night for dinner before a concert.  We were seated right away on the patio outside (also have a back patio with great views of the Pittsburgh skyline).  The drink menu has some great cocktail options as well as draft beers. I love that you can get 5oz beer samples for $3. They have a number of cider and sour beer options plus a great variety of summer seasonal beers.  My husband went with a shandy from Harpoon and I sampled a sour beer.   For my entree I went with the burger which came with blue cheese, grilled apple and arugula.  They did not skimp on the blue cheese and with the apples it made the perfect combo.  I also love that you can choose your side and they have other options besides fries.  I went with the cucumber salad which was served in a mason jar and was pickled-so fresh and flavorful.  My husband got the fries with his burger topped with pork belly and they were fresh cut. We will for sure be going back.

D1QQAEDm4cms5E1E2rSJIQ.text: Delish and fun. Friendly staff. Strong drinks. Good happy hour. Highly recommend, even for Sunday brunch!

6p1MhtJgb36zksbJfziAHQ.text: I've been here three times and every time the bartenders are so nice! They have a great cocktail menu and the build your own bloodys are fabulous. Reasonably priced and a great atmosphere with the indoor/outdoor seating. Definitely recommend and will be back!

jW0H3bG-T0piHB-0F19Hxg.text: Very good brunch. Some of the most unusual menu items!. Huevos Rancheros are made on a waffle.

chDH7awTdH1GZXz0ID6VhA.text: Coughlin's is definitely worth a shot. I met a group of friends on Saturday night (a week after opening I believe). We got to hang out outside while in line. The combination of the inside and outside atmosphere was awesome. We were sitting on the brick wall and a waitress came over to take our drink order while we waited which was much appreciated. They had an excellent draft menu. The food menu looked good and the food was good! I gave it three stars for the service and the fact they were running out of food at 8 o'clock on a Saturday night. I didn't rate it lower due to it being an extremely new place and obviously there will be kinks to work out. I had the carnitas tacos which were fine, but I wouldn't order again. The fried pickles were good as well. Looking forward to giving this place another try in a few months or so.

nS5vDEkl2LiTKBIHGGEphA.text: This place was ok.  My husband and I went with 2 friends around 7 on Friday night.  It was crowded outside with a bunch of frat boys drinking beer.  We were seated immediately and our service was very fast and friendly.  We had the maple old fashioned and it was ok, Jim Beam is not the best.  We also had some beers and got the chips as an appetizer which were pretty good.  I got the burger with onions and it was prepared perfectly and was delicious.  My husband got the smoked burger and the presentation was very cool and he said it was pretty tasty.  Our friends also said their food was great.  I am only giving this place three stars because it's nothing new and it was really loud.  I'd go back during a non-peak time.

AXAk1wN7hPqqzIvZfuI4sg.text: I would definitely recommend checking this place out. It has a super cool, open vibe. A great atmosphere for drinking in the summer! However, I did sadly give it two stars. The service wasn't great, but I don't think that's ever amazing when a restaurant first opens. Our drink orders were messed up but they then brought the correct order and didn't charge us. My main disappointment was the food. We ordered buffalo chicken dip as an appetizer and I was underwhelmed. I tried to order the Reuben as an entree but they were out of it. I then ordered a Chicken Cobb salad instead and the chicken seemed to be like shredded chicken out of can. It was a large portion but lacked freshness. The menu was also a bit confusing. Definitely looking forward to going back for beverages as they had some good beers on tap, but most likely won't be back for food.

0BmvSdyP7hsLZ3FZqEJzRw.text: Just had drinks and dinner there with my family as my sons recommended the place.  Very busy and loud so we had to wait for a table.  The Blackened Ahi tacos were good but not spicy at all.  The Buffalo Chicken dip was good and 4 tiny naan bread pieces and a couple of celery sticks wasn't enough for the dip, so they charged $4 for 4 more pieces.  Really!!!  The brisket sandwich was good too per hub.  We will definitely stop again.

73Py4pXOgxxM_5Rbe2Ec_g.text: This place was awesome! The service was excellent, the beer list extensive, and the food was really good. I loved the butternut squash ravioli and my friend's French fries were a delicious cross between potato chips and french fries. We all enjoyed the beer and the food, friendly waitress and staff and such a nice relaxing atmosphere! We plan on going back !

ZyBUT94MvPXec5ugTtXGEA.text: I met two of my girlfriends last night at Coughlin's Law and was excited to hit a new spot up in Mt. Washington. While, I love both Bigham Tavern and The Summit for food (and the Summit's cocktails), I'm not a huge fan of other casual restaurants in the area.   They had $5 mules as a special, I opted for a martini but my girlfriend got one and said they were really good. We decided to just order appetizers and share them. We shared kung pao shrimp,  pretzel sticks, fried pickles and brussel sprouts. The pretzels were stock frozen pretzels that were tasty only in the fact that pretzels are inherently tasty. The beer cheese and  whole grain mustard they came with were both good though! The kung poa shrimp was just fried shrimp with sweet thai chili sauce and peanuts on it. All in all tasty but nothing special. I honestly would have loved the pickles...they weren't overly breaded and they were thin and crispy. However, they were super super salty. I was pretty sad because they also came with a dill dip that was also really good. If they just didn't salt them after the fry, I think they'd be stand out for sure. The sprouts were probably my favorite! They were cooked really well and had a nice zesty lemon dip!  Plus I'm always happy to eat sprouts at a restaurant that aren't covered in balsamic and truffle (though i love those too).   Overall, it was a decent experience with a good bit of room for improvement! The staff was super nice and my server seemed a little nervous but it came off kind of charming. I am sure I'll be back again and maybe  my rating will increase!

o4S4oj7qTan53sHuDKjZzg.text: Have been here many times in the past few months and each time there was a different promo, such as build your own Mule, another time for Mimosa's, etc. The team is always really friendly and seemed to get along with each other in terms of their support and interaction in front of customers. I loved all the food and have not had a bad meal. The vibe is great no matter the time of day... It's definitely the first place on my mind when I think about going out in the Mount!

W5htWfVsnOpcAHAhryg3lQ.text: Definitely a better bar than restaurant, and not by much. The space is really cool and great for good weather but the execution beyond that is not good. They offer 5 oz pours of their drafts so my plan was to get two 5 oz beers as I wanted to try both.. they were out of both. Our waiter was pleasant, but timing is bad, but I understand they are probably still working out the kinks. Food was average at best. Brisket nachos were ok, carnitas tacos were not good.

1ZOZi3ztWkp9MMZ3g26CxA.text: Over priced, and terrible food. Gave this place so many chances being that it is walkable from my house. I have got food off of each section of the menu and didn't like any of it. They try to serve fancy food items but I can't pull it off. I only come for the one beer and the last 2 times I've tried they have been out of it.

kz6j1_H-06g6wEvpreppvA.text: Came for brunch on a Sunday. Seems they opened before they were even close to being ready. No one enjoyed their food- most notably, the baby food slop in a bucket that came out cold and borderline gray. Had a couple of orders of the steak and eggs. One steak was mostly fat, the second order's eggs were so overdone, it was like a cement slab of egg. Which they could have used to finish building the place, because half of the area was still under construction (detour around the heavy construction equipment). The fried pickles were so salty they burned. Maybe they can iron out the kinks but certainly have injured their rep by forcing an early opening. One member of our party had been to jail and claimed the food there was better. Good luck.

JgaqEkje5P4ggvgT3ZJbgA.text: Let's talk about this location. What an AMAZING job Coughlin's Law did with this now-gorgeous piece of real estate. The manicured landscaping and overall appearance is so inviting, especially in the summer months when you can take advantage of the lovely outdoor dining area. The quality of food definitely matches the quality of design, thus raising the overall food standard on the Mount a few notches, in my opinion. I enjoyed a hefty order of Huevos Rancheros -- always a bit risky in Western PA, let alone in a gastropub setting. It didn't disappoint. The blue corn waffle was delicious and the toppings a great mix. My only thought would be to bake the waffle to the edge of overdone, since the heaping portion of brisket and eggs on top made it a bit soggy. Other than that, two huevos up. The rest of the brunch bunch ordered the CL breakfast (a great standard), vegetarian "burger" (too sweet for many), the breakfast burger and roasted vegetable omelet (the largest omelet in all the land). The service was impeccable, and our server went out of her way to accommodate my GF buddy. Definitely check out this awesome addition to Pittsburgh's favorite mountain!

6bxGoT9LJGW1Pq7rIu8IHA.text: Came out on a whim this evening and ended up at Coughlin's Law. Order two drinks and the chips and beer cheese app. We were planning on ordering more but once you mess up chips and cheese we decided we could not go on. No seasoning on the chips,a thimble of cheese and the most bland salsa of the land! All for $7.00. Huge bummer!

OLz7bQ4UCTgbbzvuELHYRg.text: LOVE this place. The food was awesome and the view is incredible. They also turned off the outdoor fans because our party was cold. The manager risked his well-being to climb a ladder to turn off the fans. He checked on us then to make sure the food was perfect.

JhKB95QSMf5UAOPK4vuNPg.text: With any new place, I don't focus on the service as I know they are working the process out.  That was the main downfall for me was the service wasn't great.   Food was good. My wife and I split a few apps.  It was good gastropub type food.    The beer selection on the menu was good but there were a few kicked kegs while we were there (my top 3 choices were kicked). But a lot of local breweries on tap which was great to see.   The atmosphere was really cool.  A lot of open space and outdoor seating, will be great when weather stays nice.   All in all, I was happy with it!

qhZYWGHmGwiAZ7fa9BFo1g.text: I loved the atmosphere, and the servers were so quick and accommodating. The food however was not all as good as it looked on the menu. We got the bacon lollipops... which were delicious. My husband and I got the Carnitas tacos and the brisket tacos which were lacking flavor. We also ordered the jalapeno cheddar bucket of fries Which I thought would have come with a cheese sauce on top but instead came with a lot of jalapenos and hardly any melted shredded cheese. I would go back due to the atmosphere, the good service and drinks but I do not recommend the food we ordered besides the bacon lollipops.

tnGktMZQzCcMrQNSCPt0Vw.text: we had a group of 15 that we went for brunch and to watch the Steelers game.  We had Jules as our server and she was out of this world.  The food, drinks and atmosphere were great as well!! We will definitely be back and thanks to Jules for the amazing time !!

C-fCoKoANfEL_oUifPaOgA.text: We went for the 3rd or 4th time today. All times before have been great. Today, my husband and I barely noticed it was taking a while for our food to come out...we've been looking for houses so we were just consumed with searching on our phones and discussing pros and cons. The only reason I mention this is because before we could even notice it was taking a while, our server, Julianne, was over to explain the situation, apologize and offer to get us anything in the mean time. The manager, Brad, also came over to apologize. They brought out our sides to hold us over and our burgers came out shortly after. Brad was so nice and took care of the bill for us. I rarely write reviews but great customer service is rare and I was so surprised by the lengths they went. The food and drinks are great too!

cPXWKQvybolIIeOgxSe0Yw.text: Great place.  Great indoor / outdoor atmosphere.  Good for sports in TV- plus corn hole!  The staff was fantastic, very helpful Very diverse menu.  And the kicker--  My wife loved the black widow cocktail- intimidating looking drink

4k6y2pt6kE4OsOBbFSDHqA.text: My first time here with two friends. Service was quick. Food is delicious! Our server was Paige she knows her stuff. Location is great! I had the quesadilla and Taco's all delicious! Just need to get parking lot on Shiloh Strert open!

0FSXOxAjoByIUcinGRga-Q.text: We went on opening day so I honestly assumed the worst. What a nice surprise! First let me preface this by saying I have lived on Mt Washington for 3 years (downtown for 4 before that) and this is the first new opening I can remember ever seeing up here. Since opening day we've been back many times. They have a decent food menu but it's been slightly hit or miss but the drinks do not disappoint! Their infused beers are super cool. It his a little pricier based on what you get for drinks but I love trying new stuff since their selection is so big and so many local options. I will say one night we went with a group of 10 of us a couple of the guys were getting Miller Lites on Penguins special. The waitress never told them that the special ended and when we got the check they were the same price as higher end beers there. It's fine, but I wish they would've told them so they could've experienced something better for the price but also, don't come to a bar like this and order a Miller Lite! lol. They have fun social media presence (I work in social media so I love this). For example, they posted that if you spotted the Elf on the Shelf during Christmas and told your server you would get a free drink. The holiday beer came in a Santa mug with a cookie. Super fun! The decor is super urban and industrious. The bar is huge and I love the patio area with the windows open looking in. Great view of the city from the back deck as well! All in all, come for drinks, stay for the atmosphere. Just be warned if you're an IC Light kind of person this may not be the place for you!

KzEEYN9KM_cJ8KxQ1vFuuA.text: Cheyenne gave us incredible service for brunch. Delicious food and drinks! I highly recommend

qXiXB8gT22knwW1N3qJjPQ.text: Really cut down the brunch menu since they've opened. Missing some kick from their spicy entrees and drinks.  Food in general has gone down a star.  Regular fries are not good but sweet potato fries are the best Ive ever had.   Very good dradt beer list. Always a good time. Casual. Usually a little crowded.

68rngI6tJoKFz3-7i8WMPw.text: Great place. Food was very good. Sit outside the view is great. I had the fried chicken BLT. Really good with a bumbleberry blueberry IPA

baRTJKlwtMKZpkaZMxr8gQ.text: I came here tonight for a friend's birthday. They have a great outdoor area where we were all able to congregate and get drinks at the bar. When we got there, a manager told us that we would be getting a waitress. We waited about twenty minutes to order a drink because we had already been introduced to her. I ended up ordering our drinks and food at the bar because she never showed up. The rest of the night went really smoothly and we didn't have to wait very long at the bar to order drinks. I would absolutely return again soon if I am in the area.

9H4TeqWbHDCW8KuOgp2R7Q.text: Bartender was very rude. Burger was over cooked and she was upset when I returned it as she tried correcting me (I'm a chef) that my well done burger was pink. I asked for sweet potato fries and got regular fries as well. Food is over priced for volume and quantity. Burger was ok the second time. Was medium well but I didn't want to waste anymore food. Its not hard to cook a burger or to properly write down and order-in a sandwich and a side. But when it takes over 15 minutes to receive a simple order and you charge someone $15 for a sandwich and sides that doesn't fill you, it's upsetting.

2-1RYn3yKMne0PisKSxq6g.text: Cool hangout spot with an awesome view of the city on the back patio and cool hangout outdoor in the front as well.  I view this more as a cocktail and social hangout than a restaurant by the layout but the food is definitely good enough for a fine restaurant.

8SgWkynmUJU9O_0y3Fly2g.text: I did order Cob Salad it was  Really good  and also a order Long Island  It was good too. My wife ordered tacos ,and it was good too.

YTaP9kzsJODk0AO-SYaOig.text: Good happy hour and apps place. However, not a great dinner place. Food was overpriced and the portions were small. Food was lukewarm when it did come out.

m5fQJlf663l3JR-mCXUeeA.text: The food here is horrible. Nothing seems fresh or from a local farm as their menu suggested. Went on a Tuesday and a beer they had posted about on their Instagram wasn't available.

AAR3o8ksSkMxLSoAZqg6Jw.text: Cool place to hang out and drink some brews an our waitress was super attentive an awesome the whole night with a party of 10+, but the food needs soo much work! The tacos sounded good, but the meat literally had no flavor and tortillas were soggy. Salads came out on big plates but had barely any lettuce? I will say the smoked wings were pretty damn good though, so keep that up! Overall great experience, but food definitely needs some major attention!

ljL1IacRdkv5NarbVKR_tQ.text: Came here with friends to grab a drink and enjoyed the experience. Ever since this restaurant had opened, it has looked pretty full throughout the week with customers out on the patio, which is why we wanted to check it out. They have a great selection of beer and ciders, a variety that has something for everyone's personal taste. We didn't order any food, but looking through the menu they had some delicious sounding options. However the prices of food were on the higher side for a bar (appetizers were the same price as an entre). I enjoyed the casual atmosphere of the restaurant and the multiple tvs showing different sports. The patio area looked nice and would be great to go with friends on a summer day or night.

pP0SfdsNCnN_84VZVDsJ1g.text: Fun place with an awesome setup! Friendly and knowledgeable service. Mike is an awesome server! Totally worth the uber up the hill for a classier experience!

5FAFj_QqhNDoCscyZKn5Kg.text: Server, hannah, was absolutely miserable the entire time but loved the space and drinks otherwise. Would come back but avoid her sections

H85mnSPgzRl6P8zCRjKtfQ.text: If you want a restaurant that is steps away from a fantastic view of Pittsburgh, then you've found it. Looks like street parking is your only option here. For a late night visit on a weekday there were actually quite a few people there. Plenty seated around the bar area which opens to an outdoor seating area. They didn't have any balcony seating available, they had a large party over in that area so we were seated at a table. Our server was actually really nice, he checked on us many times. They were also good about keeping the table cleared of empty glasses and plates which I like. My problem was that our table was consistently being dripped on(condensation) by the overhead a/c exposed ductwork. No, we didn't ask to be moved because honestly for most of the meal I think we though it was just moisture from the water glasses on the table . Wednesday night was $5 wines/cider/sangria night. I decided on the grilled Caesar salad and a sangria. I have to say I was very surprised when the salad came, not at all what I was expecting. I'm not saying it was a bad thing, but I believe that the menu should describe what you're getting so you aren't shocked when it comes. It was 2, what I would consider small, grilled romaine lettuce leaves with Caesar dressing, anchovies and parmesan and a huge piece of grilled bread. The bread I believe was supposed to be garlic toast and I didn't get any garlic flavor, but it was good and a nice addition to the salad. The salad was actually delicious, the crispy anchovies were fabulous. My only problem is that it was Very small and I wasn't expecting it prepared that way since the menu did not say that. The sangria was good, pretty weak, but that's what I expect these days at every restaurant with daily drink specials! Overall it was a good experience, is probably come back, and hopefully get a chance to sit out on the balcony.

photos.caption: Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled Caesar Salad. Small, but good.

E3x1I48FtBl8pHg49Uthcw.text: I follow Coughlin's on Instagram. During a long day of studying, they posted their Thursday $5 moscow mule special. Luckily, I am not the only one who follows their instagram page and convincing others to join was easy. It was my first time to Coughlin's and it was perfect for what I was looking for last night. A nice, relaxing evening outside, sipping on a wonderful Moscow Mule with the friends, that I not only came with but then others that we ran into upon our arrival. Our waitress, Cheyenne was a great and stayed on top of things as more people joined and the Moscow Mules were a fan favorite. I stuck to the traditional, but they have a wide selection including jalapeno, basil, peach and berry. We will definitely be going back. Good news, their instagram promotes a different special every night.

Np5szLFh2vXNCiZJQRUKPw.text: Coughlin's law never seems to get it right when I'm there.  Tonight was no different. I understand a late night menu, but when you start serving it at 10, and it was only 9:45 don't tell me that's all you have.    Three times there, three times I've been disappointed.  This time it wasn't for long since I just left.  But I keep holding they can get their act together but they keep falling short.  Mediocre food, poor service, loud and less than inviting feel makes me not want to go back.  I keep trying because it's walking distance, but they don't make it easy to keep giving them chances.  I think this might be the last time.    So much potential, so little delivery.

RYoaFr4jOzzPIiMyPt7JKQ.text: Had a great meal with my family here.  Had the Nachos Brisket, a huge cobb and avocado salad and mix and match tacos.   All over the top    Defiantly recommend

SvsRsN-wp7JyZRh_TegifQ.text: This place has a great selection for beer and it's great that the "No Wait" app can be utilized.   The food however, is overpriced and average. Ordered the buffalo chicken dip, and the fried pickles as appetizers. Fried pickles were great.   For entrees we ordered the brisket sandwich/Big Tex (after being told they were out of wings) and the tacos. The tacos were $13 for 3, and were nothing special.   The rating is largely based on the food and pricing.

MUlceOL9Nau8EQPnFZtrlQ.text: Ordered the berry sangria and nibbled on some food that my friends ordered. All around tasted good and I really enjoyed my drink. There were a lot of servers working, a mix of tables to accommodate bigger and smaller parties, and there was a good ambiance. I would come back here if I was in the area.

lvYuBfbg_aSv060s93p0OQ.text: My girlfriend and I came here during the middle of the week at about 5 and it was excellent. Our server Abbie was very kind and helpful. I got the brisket tacos and a beer and they were delicious. Prices seemed fitting for what you got, I would recommend!

_EEHhkM_rWFaNQ3br5GjPw.text: First visit to this new, awesomely located, hip bar/eatery - pub in Mt. Washington. First impression is a staff and definatley a management that seems a bit stressed out already. That's all good. It's new. But let me tell you that the best places on Mt. Washington give the Best service and are Always friendly (see Bigham Tavern). Seems like a lot of hires are new to the bar game, I see empty plates and glasses everywhere on the bar, and around the tables. See people waiting for service when there's four to five people behind the bar. Again, it's new and people are spinning with all the new things to do to impress the owners. Understood. First visit.   Menu items, small menu, some are not available or sold out. Wanted the Cuban. What I did get was quite good. Breakfast Tacos. Price was a tad high since half a block down two eggs, bacon, and pancakes with hash costs $6, but the presentation was excellent!!! and the food was very delicious. Save the hash, over salted, couldn't eat it. I said as much.   Atmosphere is on point, menu looks fresh and hip, beers and drinks (specialty ones too) are flowing and the patio/bar is excellent looking. Whole place looks fantastic. Tiny kitchen, feel a tad sorry for those back there. Great build-out altogether. Congrats. Will be back several times I hope. Can only get better.

sFBRSRQ64ql6BmiXpYnMgA.text: Holy shit, loved this place. All the leftovers of Carson City Bar cronies in one place! Loved the fried pickles, the burger was excellent, so many beers to choose from. Go Friday night for DJ Dale & Redhot. They play the best music. Somebody might even get on the bar an sing a song and paper the bar with bar napkins!

59dm_LFZamevwhrTtNXsrA.text: As long as you aren't looking for a good quality meal, Coughlin's is awesome.   Beer and cocktail list is great and ambiance & views are even better. However, the food is subpar at best and extremely overpriced. I'd recommend against getting any of the dips - when they first opened, we ordered the hummus and it came with 4 pitas. Terrible ratios.  We tried to buffalo chicken dip a few months later after the waitress told us they fixed the ratios - we still had to order 2 extra plates of pita just to eat all the mediocre buffalo chicken dip. Okay, cool.. nbd should only be a few dollars extra. NOPE. Jokes ok us, for each extra serving (of 6 small pitas) it was $4! Insane. If you're going to have dips, at least give people enough stuff to eat it with.   I didn't even know what possible to mess up wings but coughlins has found a way.   Besides that I've never had any meal that I was anything above average quality.   But ya as long as you aren't hungry, coughlins is awesome.

hQxdEShwDx_aGCMFYcSn2A.text: Good service, cool atmosphere, tasty drinks, but don't plan on eating here...  Came to Coughlin's thinking the brunch menu looked delish, but the food was disappointing.  If I was rating on the chicken & waffles and breakfast bucket alone, I would give it 0 out of 5 stars. Just go for patio drink. Recommend the bloody Mary or the crushes!

-CdDfcnAOq7yYjnbWJmU_g.text: The Mount is so much better off with a place like this in the location that it's in, but the food needs to improve a bit before this becomes more than drinks and snacks. Another reviewer hit the nail on the head: "While I was planning to mention that they have THE worst fries in Pittsburgh... (serious guys just make some fresh cut fries... it'll go a long way!) "  Also, TOO MANY things are smoked. Not every ingredient needs to be smoked to make it interesting. If the fries improve and everything was a dollar less, I think the rest of the plates are great. They opened up a taco stand next door but did not fully integrate the drinks and food into their seating area, which is strange. I think it's still growing into itself but needs a couple tweaks before it becomes a 5-yelp-star place.

B_W1ptLr0c4ruSQ3F0cvfg.text: Great view and great food! Got the beyond burger with the All American toppings and cleaned my plate. Plenty of variety as well.

4xvjQs9oggep8_6nmSdJXw.text: Food is above average for the bar Beer selection is excellent  Atmosphere is decent Location is excellent Service is TERRIBLE!  The bartenders do a great job but God bless your patience if you get a table. The servers are so slow and get your drink orders wrong/mixed up. They either hired a bunch of terrible servers or they are severely understaffed. Either way, just come for the beers at the bar and order some food at the bar if you're hungry.

1wK8Cb-BtYrlFp2NK7O2Eg.text: Went there for dinner and drinks. They have a wide range of beer and drinks and a menu that intrigues your taste buds. We got their guac burger and it was delicious. Their prices on beer is above average but they do offer happy hour and different specials. The prices on food based on the proportion of food are also high.   Our service however sucked. I would not recommend having the waitress Abby. We waited a long time to have our drinks ordered, which the hostess came back over to take. Then waited again to have them delivered. She then never came back over to check on us. It was another waitress that had noticed our drink emptied for some time that had told her for her to come over to our table. She forgot about a drink I had ordered then lied about putting it in telling us "it said someone had ran it over." We then watched her go put the drink in to which she came back and said "the beer just tapped". Just be honest. We had put our second drink order in with the hostess as she seemed more attentive.  If it wasn't for having a friend with us we would have left after waiting so long to order the first drink and appetizer.

XOP47O9Mihy5uQ4wjWc2aw.text: Been for drinks a few times. Great place when it's nice out. Cool patio and cocktails are yummy. A little pricey for the crowd but it's always busy.   Because of the crowd, service can be lacking at the bar sometimes.

JUMo95IuWLMVwcW7sxqMaQ.text: Food options were exciting. And actual food was delicious. Great view of the city. Laid back staff. A little over priced but was worth it.

Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kung Pao Shrimp
Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. YINZER TACOS

whJsQGybyOX0LXrLZYSB1w.text: I went on a Friday around 9pm. The atmosphere is nice as well as the interior of the establishment. The bar inside also opens to an outside patio/bar area, which was cool. I didn't try the food but I found a typo in their menu. They spelled it "Bahn mi burgers". I pointed that out to the bartender and wrote down the correct spelling for him, which was "Banh mi burgers". He said he'd pass it along but then left it on the counter and a bunch of items sat over it later on...at least pretend to take it with you.   Furthermore, there is no such thing as a Banh mi burger...Banh mi means sandwich...so is this a sandwich burger?? If you're going to attempt to serve a fusion dish, please, at least spell it correctly. Based on the actions of the bartender, I will not be returning.   Also, there is no parking.

wKBuuVpqWNFL2tejddlwhg.text: Go here to drink and for the atmosphere, but do not eat here. Giving 3 stars is extremely generous but I do really like the actual spot and want to root for them. However after a couple times now it just seems like they do not know who they want to be.  Let's start with the positives. There are plenty of beer and drink options and the location really is amazing. One time we went here for a Pens game and had a great time! The open windows are always a cool touch and they have heat lamps outside when it gets chilly. The bartender we had was awesome and helpful too! They do also have a vegan friendly burger which my friend said was delicious.   Now onto the negatives. The menu is limited- but also so random. It goes from more upscale food to bar food but the bar food all had a weird sort of twist. The first time we got the buffalo Chicken dip the manager actually came over and said "wow, it's not supposed to look like that". He did comp this which was generous. The pretzels and cheese I had were blah. My husband said his fish and chips were not anything special also.  The last time we came here we started with chips and salsa. Impossible to screw up, right? I guess not. The cheese was runny and flavorless. The salsa tasted like just tomatoes. The chips looked good with a seasoning on them but they were so bad and made my stomach hurt immediately. My husband got a burger which he did like and I asked him to get French fries because I remember they were fresh cut and good the first time. Nope, seemed like frozen fries to me now. I was so annoyed... we left and went to eat at Bighams.  Also, the first time we came our card was charged twice. We called and spoke to the manager and he was super friendly about it saying he would look into it and call us back... never happened. I understand they had just opened and were super busy but come on.  Again- come here for a Penguins game or Happy Hour but do not come hungry. I really Hope they figure things out so I can at least get a snack with my beer!

Nr8fcxw3a5CuouXM0sPa5w.text: They have a weird menu. Not good for children. The food that we got was good but, very different.

KHKmG74FmvhrLTQx7bv2ZA.text: Absolutely the worst customer service I've witnessed in my career. The biased, if not sexist, attendant at the door made it so uncomfortable to the point we left knowing he was denying manager info for job security.  Makes ya curious of owners business morals...

L6iAVCIB-mB5ULP0yCg_nw.text: AMAZEBALLS! All I have to say about this place!  We stopped to see some friends play music and tried some food and cocktails and we were not let down. We decided to split the COUGHLIN'S BURGER Pickles / Smoked Cheddar / Pork Belly / Chili Slaw / Bacon Jam / Smoked Aioli Man this has to be one of the BEST burgers I have ever eaten! It came out under a dome glass surrounded by smoke and the waitress removed the dome and the smell was fantastic! We cut it in half and devoured the thing. It was so juicy with delicious flavors and the hint of smokiness was Devine! We paired it with the sweet potatoes fries that will not disappoint either.  I went out of my comfort zone and tried their I DR. TURNERS NOVOCAINE cocktail Jim Beam Black / Honey Syrup / Lemon Juice / OJ / Buzz Button  It was a different experience but one that I won't soon forget. They give you a "buzz button" to eat before you drink this lovely cocktail.  So if your in the area I would stop by here to try some interesting and delicious food

E_615yCYM6c_xVxrXAoi9Q.text: I have been wanting to eat at coughlins law for about 7 months now, and it didn't disappoint! We ordered 4 apps - bacon lollipops, ricotta plate, bacon dip, and brussel sprouts - and they were all incredible! Especially the ricotta plate!! The atmosphere was fun, servers were all very nice, and the view is incredible. Only small issue was parking.... but it definitely won't keep me from returning soon!

baaBuJrQMd0k3X-v4xKKeA.text: I was really excited to try this spot but unfortunately the food I had was mediocre.   Ordered the Brussels sprouts appetizer. I liked the dish with the almonds and cheese adding to the taste, but it was very oily.   The burger I ordered was bland and was dry. The sweet potato fries were fine.   The attraction here is most likely in the beer specials, not the food. Was hoping this spot would have more flavor and creativeness in the food.

xeWjgEbbqjdmiaJTor1kyQ.text: Go here often it's in my neighborhood... the food I hate wasn't the best but the venue is AMAZING... what a great view of the city! The bar area is huge with tons of drinks.. they have tons of garage doors and a covered deck out back with a view... u can drink outside in the front almost directly up to the street.. they have cornhole stations set up.. awesome neat different place that's whimsical and new.. always packed when nice out.. I get the fatheads bumbleberry and she got a strawberry basil.. ive also had the maple bacon old fashioned

rNSkjNj8m0vIWbF6Q6bK-A.text: I used the waitlist option on here and I'm so glad I did, there was quite a wait when we got there, but we got seated right away.   We started with their bacon lollipops and they were sooooo good. Just the right amount, you definitely don't want to eat a lot of these in one sitting, but their sweet and spice levels were perfect.   I got the steak entree and I'm so glad I did. The steak was cooked perfectly. The sweet potato hash was unique, but not over the top. The blue cheese mouse may have been my favorite part, I'm asking for more next time!!   My husband got the pasta entree and it was soooo good. I said I would get that next time I went!

photos.caption: Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-PMJdcXlwlVpThS4I8BmFA.text: Went here with my boyfriend on a trip to Pittsburgh and were very satisfied with the service and the food. Our waitress, Abbie, was very nice and pleasant. I got the Big Tex pulled pork and it was amazing. My boyfriend got a variety of tacos and he said they were very good as well. They also have great drink deals throughout the week. Overall would highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Big Tex

HqwD-VEjL46jGf168ZAeBg.text: So we came on day 3 of being open. So obviously, they still need to work out the kinks. First, I want to say how nice and friendly everyone who working this Sunday brunch was. The managers and bartenders really made our experience pleasant!  It's very nice inside and I love the decor. They even have purse hooks and outlets at the bar! A few things were a little messy, but of course things are probably crazy because they are sooo new!  They have a lot of hands on deck and it seems they make teamwork an important part of their philosophy which I really love!  So how about they had an AWESOME vegan chickpea and sweet potato burger with yummy sweet potato fries. The food was nice and hot and plated nicely. My friend had the soft pretzels and she said they were decent, obviously just your standard pretzels but who cares, sometimes simple is great!  I look forward to coming back when it's warmer out and seeing how great they are doing!

photos.caption: Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hG9CRnMDCxcK0z_NeZ3mbg.text: I agree with previous posts. Tons of potential, has some growing pains to work through.  Pros: pleasant staff. They are hard working and it was BUSY. Engaging, hardworking. No complaints. They also have a great outdoor scene with plenty of space. And HEATERS!! Overhead heaters that made it tolerable to sit outside when it was chilly. You win on that one. Lots of great beers, too. Good selection broken down on the draft list by types, which is helpful.  Cons: process. The wrong draft list was on our table. They have a number system for their beers, so a "13" was actually an "18" because an old list was floating out there. And because the person who got it drank about half before he said something, we were charged for the mistake. Food. It's just okay. Pretzels were so-so, nachos were just not good. They need to take more pride in presentation and a lot of that could be resolved.  It's a cool place and will likely be well attended for the area it's in. I'd go back in a while when they get into their groove.

pHymzhWdJ5NFEHjGGMTZ-w.text: We heard great things about this place so we gave it a try.  It's has a great vibe and the weather was perfect for them to have their garage doors open.  We had about a 30 minute wait so we went to the bar and grabbed a drink.  The bartenders were nice and attentive but they made my 2nd drink wrong which was a one cause for not having 5 stars. We ordered two drinks each while we waited for a table and the same bartender made my drink wrong the second time after I reconfirmed what I was having.  I didn't complain.    Our waitress was awesome and perfect from start to finish.  I had the Mix and match tacos which you get to pick 3 out of the 4 tacos and my friend got the Cobb salad.  We split jalapeno cheese fries and the salted Carmel ice cream sandwich which wasn't actually a sandwich but it was AMAZING.  My tacos were good, the fries were made with cheap cheese which got hard fast. They were...okay and my friend really enjoyed the salad.    Overall it's a cool spot for drinks and some appetizers but it's just an above average place with some bar food.

8-emJVUWZdtiK-8fanColQ.text: If you can find this place nestled on a corner hillside in Mt. Washington you should stop for a cocktail or meal.  I came here for brunch with a small group - and yes, they take reservations - and we were seated outside, in the front of the building.  There's outdoor seating in the back as well.   Service was great.  Our waitress was super friendly and attentive to our orders.  Every time our glasses were empty she was back with a carafe of water.   The brunch menu has a few good options.  They also have a 'make your own bloody Mary' menu if cocktails are part of your brunch story.  I wasn't feeling very "breakfasty" so I ordered the Farmhouse Burger.  It was made with an egg on it so it fulfilled the breakfast requirement.  The side was an order of tasty fries.  The burger also had a nice jam spread on the bun, also providing an illusion of breakfast food.   I was most impressed with how out-of-the-way they went to accommodate my friend's gluten free diet.  They were very careful to assure no gluten was in the dish.   The omelets looked delicious and were pretty much the size of a horse's head.   I look forward to coming here another time for lunch or dinner.

WvIjChOM5QMiIxV7QFysiw.text: Let me preface this by saying I wish we could give 1/2 stars because I probably would give this a 3 1/2.  First, it's pricey. I came here for brunch and got the "big" meal ($11) and a mimosa ($8). Don't get me wrong, the food and drinks were really good. I got the 'Breakfast with a View' which came with 2 eggs, home fries, bacon, sausage, and one slice of toast. Everything was there and it was plenty but I was a little surprised that the toast was just one slice and the home fries could probably fit in a small dressing container. Like I said, it was the perfect amount of food (left feeling full but not bloated) but for $11 it seemed like there was something missing. I also got the build-your-own mimosa. This starts at $6 for just the basic champagne + juice (orange, grapefruit, pineapple, or another that I'm forgetting) and then you can do add-ons ($1 for a sherbet and $2 for a puree). It was very good but also pretty small as it was served in a more traditional champagne flute.   What you're really paying for is the ambiance. We sat on the back patio and it has a really different and cool view of the city. It also makes you feel much more secluded, so it was perfect for a nice date. The front of the building also seemed that it would be a good place to sit. There's basically three/four different sitting areas; back patio (secluded), indoors (traditional style), indoor/outdoor bar (perfect for the solo diner and drinker or for a small group looking for drinks), and outdoor front patio (a bit more lively).  I probably will go back. The rest of the menu seems appetizing and the draft list is extensive, but this will be saved for a 'treat-yo-self' night out and not a regular dining experience.

wW21Yqs2YaiIZzO7mZAljg.text: After being open now for a year and a half, I have just come to accept this place for what it is...a great drinking spot, with terrible food.  It is unfortunate because I love the atmosphere and drink offerings they have.  There are not many other places which have such a unique outdoor venue.  However, the food is and has always been bad.    My first time I thought maybe the disgusting buffalo chicken dip was just part of the growing pains of a new restaurant (although I'm not sure how you mess up a dish with 3-4 ingredients).  My second time I chalked up the awful tasting chips, salsas, and sloppy sandwiches again to the place being new.  However, after now being here at least 5 times, being new is no longer an excuse.  On my most recent trip we tried the new taco spot connected to the side porch.  The chicken taco was sloppy and tasted like they poured an entire bottle of liquid smoke into it.  The chicken itself was tough and dry.  None of the flavors of any of the tacos I tried came together.  At one point in our meal a group at another table was asked to leave because they had McDonalds delivered and were eating it at a table.  When asked about it by staff, one person in the group suggested that if the food at Coughlin's wasn't so terrible they wouldn't have to resort to having McDonalds delivered.  While this was rude and probably a slight exaggeration, it goes to show how people feel about the food.  In sum, with so many good places to eat on Mount Washington (Bighams, Redbeards, Shilho), eat somewhere else, but it is still a good drinking spot.

VaU0vo9WL0JwImsznslK6Q.text: I've been meaning to write a review for this place for a while now. Mostly because I've been their biggest fan since literally before they even opened and this placed was just what we needed on the mount...   While I was planning to mention that they have THE worst fries in Pittsburgh... (serious guys just make some fresh cut fries... it'll go a long way!) I was also going to mention that I was able to look "beyond" the faulty fries due to the incredible homemade veggie burger, great beer selection and relatively kind staff... The food was slightly over priced but good stuff (way better than it's sister bar Carson City) and convenient. Then today everything took a turn for the worse.   (Heads up:  vegetarian rant below)  When I went to order my weekly (LITERALLY. Guys... I ate/got take out here a lot!!) Sweet Pea Burger I noticed a change on the menu... the Sweet Pea Burger had been "replaced" with the oh so trendy "Beyond" Burger. As a strict vegetarian, I couldn't believe my eyes! BARFORAMA!!! I'm honestly not sure why these EXPENSIVE grown meat veggie patties are so popular but they should NOT be treated as a substitution for a veggie burger. If I wanted to eat something that tastes like, looks like, and feels like meat... I would just eat meat. These patties were created as a healthier option for meat eaters. Actually, I'm not even sure that meat eaters want to eat these things... yet they still seem to be popping up everywhere.   When I called to double check the change (and see if just maybe they had a sweet pea burger left for my soul) I was swiftly handed off to a manager (without asking to be) The manager seemed annoyed and "apologized" but it was far from genuine. She then proceeded to tell me while I "may have like the Sweet Pea Burger... it was (their) number one sent back item" so they are "trying something new"  Um.. what?   Honestly, I know this is a total veghead's rant... but if you're offering a veggie burger as an option, it's clearly to serve vegetarian/vegan customers and the Beyond Burger is NOT an alternative or acceptable option. It could certainly be an additional option... but it's not a viable substitution.  If you've made to the end of this review, the main point is just come here to drink...

VmC7QbvUZF5H6r3OYKgbjw.text: I really want to like this place and it isn't awful but it isn't worth going out of your way for either.  They do have an extensive drink list and menu so everyone can find something they like. I've been here twice and the service was just ok. Both times I was able to sit outside but not where there was a view of the city. The space is big outside and inside which is a plus. The food was just ok - pretty standard bar food that is a little pricey for what it is.

NVxa0DI4z3umjYVC3iodig.text: This was a very much needed and awesome addition to Mt. Washington ! I mostly come here to drink because the specials are amazing. They have daily drink specials which are perfect for people like me who can't always get happy hour. Monday's and Wednesday are faves. Monday's are 5 ounce pours $1.50 and Wednesday's are ciders, wine, and sangria days for 5 bucks . You can not beat that especially because they offer Aresenal which is my favorite cider.   We have eaten here a few times and the food is pretty decent. You can never go wrong with their tacos.  I would also try their brunch as well. They have some good specials for drinking and food. Between their signature drinks to building your own Bloody Mary.   The service and atmosphere have been good to me. I have not gone on a day that it was wall to wall crowded . I have had great experiences each time .

KYHjXUI4CGvs67y4GkCNXA.text: By far the best spot on the mount! This is always our go to & always has a good atmosphere! Cornhole, tacos & a restaurant all in one! They also have a great view from the back patio!

Yg92320CQvKwWAdDUWQ2Cw.text: Pleasantly surprised by this Ale House sitting on top of Mt. Washington. The atmosphere was more sports bar than Ale House but I liked that aspect. The folks making the bar were pretty helpful selecting a meal for the night.   My girlfriend and I shared the smoked blue cheese buff chick dip(not pictured). I've never had the dish with blue cheese, but I admit that it was good so I'll be back for more.  I had the chipotle peach & bacon burger. Different flavor profile than I expected. The goat cheese had a creamy texture that added depth to the medium well burger.   I'll be back to this place to explore more of their menu.
