Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Uo8Hp78T8pOCjfRqH3UGNQ.text: This is the spot to go to if you're looking for a place with great atmosphere on Mount Washington! Their outdoor seating area is awesome, both in the front and on the back patio. If you're a Moscow mule fan like myself, then  check it out on Thursday when it's on special! Great location as well, only a short walk to the Shiloh street shops and restaurants and Grandview ave!

8QaQrwkZBSmTSZFz-EX7ZQ.text: Great atmosphere and fun hot spot on Mount Washington. In the summer, the doors are up, and there is outdoor seating (both in the front and back) and corn hole boards on the side.   They have a creative menu and always offer specials of the week - both food and drinks! You can follow their IG account to see all the week's specials. They also have a great happy hour menu and drink specials every night. Thursday night's my favorite... $5 Moscow mules (I love the jalapeno one).   If you're looking for a quiet dinner spot, there usually isn't much of a wait if you go early. However, later into the night, it is much busier and turns into more of a bar than a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pickle pizza - one of the weekly specials

vTAuwOVoNFiIyFr24TD_PA.text: Based on other Yelp reviews, I didn't have high expectations for Coughlin's, but I also wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt. However, my experience here probably matched with the majority.   The food was not good and it was pretty expensive for what you got. Our table ordered chips and beer cheese, mix and match tacos, the walking taco burger (a special), brisket nachos and wings with smoky bbq sauce. I would say of all these items, the only one that was half decent was the wings. Beer cheese was lumpy and brisket was so incredibly dry. A positive is the drink list. They have a relatively decent selection of beers and ciders.   Service was ok. Our waitress made sure to inform us of some things about our dishes that needed clarifying, such as the smoked wings are smoked and will have a pinkness to them; it's not that they're not cooked. While our interactions with her were good, I think she forgot about us at the end. We were left waiting for a pretty long time before we got our checks.   If I were to come back, I would only come here for drinks at the bar.

8s_vn0D1oEH66VblGNJrjA.text: Really nice place, looks like it was a converted car service station.  It actually has the garage doors still there and the back ones lead out to a porch with a phenomenal view of the city.  The parking isn't great, no lot, limited street parking, I did get a taxi though, so it wasn't bad.  Stopped in on a Sunday at about 6:30 and it wasn't packed, but had some good business going on.  I wanted to try so much of the stuff on this menu.  It sounded awesome and I'm not a local, so it could be a while before I get back here.  I ordered a maple bacon old fashioned to start things off.  The drink was pretty good.  It came with a maple bacon piece on top which tasted great.  I decided on sampling a couple of the appetizers.  The Nashville hot wings and the cheesesteak poutine.  The wings were insanely huge.  It's the whole wing.  The taste was great, the seasoning had a nice kick.  The poutine was a first glance a bit disappointing.  It looked pretty bare, the fries they use are more wide than long, the meat and curds were spread around thinly.  The plate was delicious however.  I also grabbed the pork street taco.  Very tasty.  The meat was flavorful and perfectly cooked.  The dish was on point.  One of the better places I have been in Pittsburgh, which is saying a lot.  I've really come to love the town and places like this are the reason.  Keep it up,  can't wait to be back.

8wGSPFDhtIWl1dMuxhmjfQ.text: I've been here a few times now and have enjoyed every experience. They have a really nice patio out back that has a great view of the city. Their draft beer list is big with a lot a variety, it also changes pretty regularly which is nice if you like to try new things often.  This last time I went I got the buffalo chicken fry bucket. It was so good! It was a simple app, french fries with their buffalo chicken dip on top, but it was a great combination. Their buffalo chicken dip has really good flavor, spicy but not to overwhelming, and it had a ton of large pieces of chicken. It was a lot of food for an app, I ate maybe a third of it and that ended up being my dinner because it was so filling. Highly recommend!  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because the service has always just been okay every time I've been. I think that's mostly because they get pretty busy.  Note: They have a great happy hour! 5-7, $1 off drafts, and $2 off apps. Great time to go try a new beer and one of their apps.

photos.caption: Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken Fry bucket --- fries with buffalo chicken dip on them
Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The All  American

qa-Mq9C7G7ShMVbv7MsX_g.text: YUM! We loved this place!!  Came here with a large group for Sunday brunch and were seated right away. The build your own bloody mary's are an awesome concept - you essentially fill out a sheet with mix ins. They have a variety of vodkas, spice mixes, etc to choose from. The pumpkin beer with the cinnamon sugar rim was also a group favorite!  For snacks I tried the brussel sprouts and the avocado toast. The sprouts were some of the best I've had - topped with almond slivers and cheese and served with an aioli creme. The avocado toast was also pretty good although the bread could have been a tad crispier.  Overall, great service and everyone enjoyed their meals and libations!

photos.caption: Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket Sandwich
Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy Brussels
Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Avocado toast

x2rb7YWWZXGSihEYOCYFOg.text: I wanted to wait and give Coughlin's a decent few visits before reviewing them. Mostly due to their slightly disorganized opening, I wanted to see what they were like once they had everything a little more organized. My first visit, I had a few beers, a mule, and shared some hot wings. Now, I hate to sound arrogant, and this might... but I have a high standard for hot wings. I love spice, and a hot wing that isn't hot is a waste of money in my book. These weren't hot. They were more salty than hot. The full wings are interesting, but you really don't get much more meat. Hard pass.  On my most recent visit, I went for Brisket Tacos and beers. You really run a low risk of messing it up when it comes to tacos, yet somehow, they did it. The brisket was dry, yet the plate was drenched in a pool of grease. Seems to me like they were trying to resuscitate old brisket with oil but it didn't work. It would be SOMETHING if it was at least seasoned well, but alas... Flavorless and stringy. If there's a redeeming quality to Coughlin's, its in their beer list. It's a pretty decent selection.  Go for drinks and the view, relocate for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Back Patio view

y_MUrGQJpUzzKCVt0BVZNA.text: Coughlin's Law is a great addition to Mount Washington. Grandview Ave has the fine dining and Shiloh St has the bars, but this place feels more modern than almost all of them. Ownership is connected to Carson City Saloon, but you won't get a south side vibe up here. This place is a repurposed garage/gas station with an industrial look. When the weather is nice there's patio seating and Cornhole out front. It's spacious enough to accommodate large flows of people. Parking will probably be a challenge on the weekends, but I'm told there's a garage nearby. Get an Uber anyways, because they have 43 beers on tap and some potent cocktails.  This is definitely a place with food worth eating though. You can tell a lot of thought went into the menu. We started with the candied bacon lollipops, which taste as good as they sound. The flagship burger comes smoked in a glass dome that's released in front of you when it's brought out. It feels gimmicky but still prompted some "oooohhhs" from our table. The Cuban sandwich caught my eye because it was made with pork belly, Canadian bacon and Guinness mustard instead of basic ham and the yellow stuff. Premier ingredients like these are all over the menu. They also have brunch, happy hour specials, daily specials, and growler fills. Everything you'd expect in a decent gastropub.  So Coughlin's Law joins the list of upper tier craft beer restaurants in a city that already has dozens of them. But now Mount Washington has another one of their own.

yIt09pn1tJGq0wPAdEw9vA.text: Went for their Sunday brunch. I love their options of the build your own mimosa and bloody Mary's.  I got their namesake breakfast sandwich. It was tasty but the bacon on it was so hard I had to take it off. It was over cooked and probably reheated a bunch. Had the consistency of jerky. For brunch bacon is a must so I am hoping this was just a bad batch. My husband got the Huevos Rancheros and he said it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huevos rancheros
Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side of potatoes
Photo of Coughlin's Law Kitchen and Ale House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast sandwich

EGAwzB7hwT0-xM4YRlneBg.text: The bar is very close to a little parking garage, which makes parking easy - not always the case on Mt. Washington.  I was bummed that the main reason I chose this place (a unique maple creme brulee dessert) wasn't available when we were there, but it saved us money, since what I wanted to eat wasn't as expensive as the restaurant week special, so it worked out.  Monday nights, they have $1.75 5 oz pours and they have a very large beer selection. They even had 4 ciders on tap, including my favorite seasonal from Arsenal. The service was decent and the food was good. I'd definitely go back.

RvwXnE6BEDnyf3gYTNjNHA.text: This is a nice spot to hang out in the Mt. Washington area.  I visited for the first time with a few friends on a Friday night and we had a good time.  They had a decent selection of beer and liquor.  The bar itself is pretty trendy looking and has both indoor and outdoor seating.  The waitress was nice but the service was pretty slow.  My only word of caution is parking is kind of a nightmare.  We had to find street parking several blocks away in a sketchy area.

L3zXVyFhV1TvoWY1sOCeRw.text: Great menu for restraunt week. Loved the smoke brisket, cooked right in the parking lot. You can smell it for blocks. But with a name like Coughin Law, you would think they wouldn't let the employees park in the only handicapped spot. They don't care.

9g6OHnTFTHQekFxW7pctzA.text: The food is not exactly groundbreaking but it's well made. We shared the ricotta and buffalo chicken dip for our appetizers and both of us mostly liked what we ate. The dip had very large pieces of smoked chicken-- it'd be made better by shredding that chicken a bit more. The  ricotta could have used another element or two. But it was all fine.  What really disappointed me and my dining partner was the service and extremely long wait times for EVERYTHING. We sat outside at 6:55 and noticed happy hour ended at 7. We weren't greeted for fifteen minutes. During that time, I eventually tried to order at the bar. I ordered and finally our server came. When I explained to her that I ordered drinks from the bar, but hadn't paid for them yet, she became short with me and walked away saying she'd be back with the drinks I ordered from the bar. We never saw her again. The bartender brought out the drinks and we then waited nearly 20 minutes. Finally another server approached and asked if we'd been taken care of. We said we had a server but hadn't seen her for a while.  A few minutes later, the bartender comes over and he says "I let your server know. She'll be right over."   More time passes and finally a third server comes and takes our order. Our appetizers took almost 45 minutes. And our meals didn't arrive until around 45 minutes after we FINISHED eating the first course.   Everything just took so long. A night we wanted to spend walking around Mt. Wash after dinner was cut short as we spent over two and a half hours at Coughlin's Law. It's a shame because if things ran well, it might've been a nice meal.

H0zP2Wgecw-MIeQo6CIjNA.text: Our waitress was wonderful.. however food was sub-par.. I got the bucket for brunch.. kitchen refused to substitute cheddar cheese ( which is on the menu for other items) for the beer cheese...&& the bucket was super dry & barely edible... other people In our party were also dissatisfied.. one asked for no jalapeno in the omelet which had to be approved by the kitchen first, once approved it arrived slathered with jalapenos... 2 people from our party ordered the Cuban, one asked for NO mustard & was informed that was NOT an option && one wanted more mustard & was charged for it.. also, another member from our party ordered the Apple Jacks French toast & it came with very little syrup.. && when asked for extra was also charged $ for the extra syrup.. pretty disappointed other than service ....

C_yC-Nfg0zun_M4D5lLInw.text: Yasssss. So lit like season six of drag race. Next time all of the things. I want the braised collard greens, the sous vide hog max, and the broiled turkey necks. Soooo good.

G2k7aHvyXwSIdov191Q5Sw.text: we made a reservation beforehand for a seat outside and still had to wait "a while" once we got there an hour later... server suggested we "just sit inside". we decide to sit at the bar, and before we could even pick up the menu 4 different servers were hounding is for our drink order. once we perused the menu for quite some time, we could not get a server or bartender to come over to take our food order. finally one bartender took my order and completely ignored my other two friends i was with. once our food order was all in (30 mins later), we ordered our two appetizers and a burger... appetizers were disgusting! too salty, and otherwise flavorless. the burger was good but way too much bread and it was a mess. after a very mediocre to terrible night out, we headed home and literally all three of us had the worst shits all night. sorry, but True. this place is all show and no go. there are way better places in pittsburgh that are worth while!

bDgNK-ZibaKQHPgF4f6OJg.text: Just went there tonight for the grand opening -- LOVED IT! I was expecting some bumps or mishaps as it was the first night open to the public, but just the opposite. Everything was wonderful! Our server, Cheyenne, was so helpful, attentive, and welcoming. Ask for her if you stop in. She was So knowledgeable of the menu already. The menu has many choices- great apps, salads, tacos, burgers, and a few entrees. We ordered the crispy Brussels sprouts and some wings to start. So delicious! My husband got the coughlins burger which came under a smoked cloche. So cool. I got the Caesar  salad with chicken - also delicious. It came on a grilled romaine. No too overdressed or soggy like some Caesars. The prices were very reasonable as well. The cocktails and drink lists were extensive and had something for everyone. After dinner we hung out on the patio and bar area. One suggestion I do have is that the bartenders seemed so swamped -- they need a better system for making the drinks. All of the ingredients for cocktails were all over the bar so all the bartenders were rushing around bumping into each other just trying to make one drink. They should come up with a better bar system. I don't think it was their fault though, and they were all very nice and made good drinks. Otherwise though, everyone was personable and created a great atmosphere. I love that mount Washington finally has a cool place with city views and space to hang out. I would recommend this place to friends or families looking to relax and hang out, people looking for a good food and good prices. Can't wait to come back!

fVvoo79csvTYCUjetbclwg.text: I live on Mt. Washington and I'm always glad to try a new restaurant.  I had the Rasta wings which were smoky and flavorful.   I can't wait to try the different wing flavors.  With my meal I enjoyed their maple bacon manhattan which was garnished with a sweet and spicy bacon lollipop and a beer from their extensive drought list. For my entree I had the Coughlin's Burger which had a nice presentation with a smoke globe.  The burger was cooked over a fire grill and I really enjoyed the flavor of the beef.  The waitress we had was incredibly nice and attentive as well as the bussing staff.  The food came out fast and hot.  My only complaint would be: the fries were only so-so and would fair better if they were double fried.   I was thinking of giving 4 stars but the overall experience with the waitstaff pushed Coughlin's Law to a 5.  I will be back again and can't wait to try some of the other inevitably delicious items on their menu

Mqy4wdPS46UnhNMbsW4fZA.text: I like this place for many reasons.  It is a very interesting inside/outside bar that is different and I really like.  They have fire pits that are awesome.  They have a good selection of beer and the bartenders are very good and make sure everyone is taken care of despite large crowds.  I have even had (I believe) the owner or manager wait on me when it's been very busy and I really appreciate the effort for customer service.  What keeps me from giving this place five stars is the rudeness by bouncers and/or bartenders once it hits 2:00 a.m. on the dot.  Being screamed at to get out is pretty unacceptable to me customer-service wise.  I understand the liquor laws.  I work in this industry.  I know legally patrons can be in an establishment until 2:30 a.m. without penalty as long as alcohol is not purchased after 2:00 a.m.  I appreciate the fact that employees want to close up and go home.  But again, screaming at patrons at 2:00 a.m. to get out?  C'mon please have some basic customer service skills please.

mJo-tF_PG7EvYPZtJdFTRg.text: Loved the atmosphere and had great drink specials. The staff is very friendly but there are a lot of issues we faced. First issue was we showed up at 2 pm to eat brunch. They closed the kitchen completely until 3. Ended up being 330 before we could order. They served other people when the kitchen was closed because they "knew someone." My chicken BLT came without bacon and when I asked about it they said they ran out. A little bizarre considering it's called a BLT. I also tried to add cheese to my sandwich but they wouldn't allow additions or substitutions. Basically leaving money on the table in my opinion. The chicken was so fatty and inedible. I only ate the fries. I also ordered an orange crush and they ran out of OJ so I couldn't get that either. There are a lot of kinks they need to figure out. I'd highly suggest keeping the kitchen open all day and they need to be flexible with changes and substitutions on meals. They also need to figure out their inventory situation since they ran out of so much. Anyway, I'll be back to drink for the atmosphere will likely not eat here again.

pqGcd9GcFHvcPOp0d-9_Bg.text: When traveling to Pittsburgh, my go to hot spot is Coughlin's Law Kitchen on Mt. Washington! They have a extensive food and beer menu full of creative New American dishes. Coughlin's is the perfect place to get together to share a meal or watch a game with friends and family. We came for a Pens game and ordered a bunch of items to share with the table. Some of our favorites were the Brussels, Fry Bucket, Wings, Bacon lollipops, The Coughlin's Burger and Crispy Chicken BLT. Our server was super knowledgeable and recommended some awesome beers and took us through the menu. I highly recommend Coughlin's Law Kitchen.

aD84CBD-cEm-0lLJm8JclA.text: Unfortunately I have to agree with other reviewers. Great atmosphere/ambiance. Mount Washington really needed something like this. The service is always great however the food continues to fall flat. I wanted to give it a few chances before I wrote a review but each time I was disappointed in my meal. I went last night and my fried pickles barely had any breading on them relying on the sauce alone, it was pretty much a soggy pickle to dip in the sauce, my burger/fries were sub par and my cocktail was too sweet to drink. I'll continue going because of the location but probably won't eat here again. I hope they can step things up.

jdgZC6HtdCShj4eCtrHQeQ.text: Service: Decent, the waiter took awhile to come take our orders. But the food was served very quickly.  Food: presentation is very good. Taste is good. But the prices are too high. They should take a few dollars off each meal.  Drinks: very well mad and bar service was fast even with the bar being full. However, we went on a night where it was advertised as $5 mules all day Thursday but they didn't keep those prices because of a hockey game.

sME9flCIaF_P-IQATdHWSw.text: Can already tell this is going to be the go to spot this summer. We went there yesterday to watch the Pens game and it was packed! They were out of a lot of food because of how busy they are, which I will attribute to them being newly opened. Ashton was our server and he was great! The only thing that would make this place better would be allowing dogs on the patio area. Maybe in the future?

1a5wySYqa59QbuWJq31CDA.text: Horrible service had Felisha as a server and she gave us the check half way through our meal and said since you don't want anything else here is your meanwhile we had to ask for more water and we're planning on staying. It was embarrassing. I won't go back.

8ij3VnRf7AtW9iHUhw-fRQ.text: Cool new spot. Lots of TVs, great view from the patio, great line up of beer and cocktails, and the appetizers are fabulous. This is going to be a go-to spot when the weather gets nice as they can open up much of the restaurant with garage doors. Can't say enough good things about this place!

Qx_su_qaAKUw0ZtBZPLe-w.text: Was there for dinner and lunch before and loved it. Today i went for Sunday brunch and was not impressed.  I wasnt sure what to order because nothing was familiar.  I ordered chilaquiles....just a bunch of soggy tortilla chips with an egg on top.  Heuvos rancheoes were on a waffle...nor what I expected at all.  I love the muscles and will return for for dinner but brunch left a bad taste in my mouth.

_G2XCSkexYot0GqBSK9czg.text: The beer is good and reasonable, but they need a real chef. The Capresse  salad had tomatoes almost frozen out of the refrigerator, they were cold enough to hurt sensitive teeth and had no flavor because of the refrigeration. The waitress was efficient and good. One of the reasons why I gave it stars. The veggie burger is mostly comprised of sweet potatoes & sickly sweet.  They did take my order off the bill. The Summit's food is so much better, the prices are cheaper, and the mixed drinks are so much better. You get a lot more quantity and quality for every dollar you spend.

Rkc5scmJHLbxtThQ_VJ60g.text: Went for brunch and food was terrible. Ordered Bloody Mary's. Drinks didn't come out until the food arrived. Avocado toast was non toasted bread with way too much cilantro. Chaquila's were nothing more than a fried egg over soggy chips. Would not recommend eating here. Only plus was the view from the back patio.

qZghNBZ4zvIwejFU64PQDg.text: Went for brunch and enjoyed the view from the back patio.  Our server was very nice.  However nobody enjoyed their meal and our drinks came out with our meal 20 minutes after ordering.  Chaquilas came out with a fried egg over soggy chips and the avocado toast should be called cilantro with avocado mash on cold French bread.  Don't go here for the food but enjoy the view from the back patio!

A2fldrYxGQ6lYe8HFvR3qA.text: This place is a great new addition to the Mt Washington bar scene. The quality of food is somewhat inconsistent, but the service and drinks are always good! The fact that they are so new could attribute to the inconsistency. I will continue to visit. It would also be amazing if I could bring my dog with me to sit on their nice patio!

_DNN-e8FZ-GIc7oh9PXViA.text: Heard good things about this place so decided to check it out. The bar is real cool looking and a great location - like a gastropub. Looks like it should be located in Cali. We sat on the outside patio. I just got a water and ordered some food. I went with the BLT. It wasn't good at all. I figured it just be a fried chicken sandwich not that hard to mess up. The chicken was weirdly cooked like double fried or something. Couldn't even eat it. Fries were good though and their ranch so I ate that. I would go only back to grab some drinks at the bar but definitely not the food. I was disappointed also when I heard Carson City Saloon owns them because their food is AMAZING. Hopefully they work out the kinks soon.

Al7cLF11nKUK8zO-7pSaww.text: Awesome new restaurant/ bar on Mt.Washington.... a welcomed breath of fresh air for the area! Good food, extensive menu, great cocktails to suit everybody's taste. Staff was friendly and attentive, atmosphere was trendy. Great view of the city from the back patio. Will definitely return!!

wO6BOMq-nTBKdTXUunqA0w.text: Even tho this place had potential, the food didn't deliver. The BBQ platter was horrible - the brisket was extremely tough and difficult to cut, the chicken wings seemed like they needed to be smoked much longer because the meat stuck to the bone and was rubbery , the pulled pork was extremely dry and cold. To top it off, none of it tasted like it was smoked but rather that a bottle of liquid smoke had been poured on top then microwaved. I understand this isn't a BBQ restaurant but this was by far the worst BBQ I've ever had.

LU7GCXdDyaNVWxMAptTxxg.text: Liked the atmosphere and the lay out of this restaurant, but not a fan of the smoked foods offered. If you are a fan of the smoked taste, then you will like this place. I had the Cuban and the smoked flavor was too overwhelming. Tasted like propone would smell, not good for me. The service was good, server was Mike and he was very friendly and very attentive. Good beer selection. My wife had the Tacos mix and match (sweet potato, fish, pork), she said they were ok, but again the smoked flavoring on the pork tacos was not her taste preference either. Nice place to hang out and have a few beers, nice view from the back porch overlooking the city. I will try again and not have anything that says "smoked", burgers may be an option next time. Overall it was ok.

9CJ4Qb9Qf_xlRd_J6TTANw.text: My pretzels were still frozen on the bottom and the dip tasted like beer foam. The carnitas tacos are too smoky and the view is average. Only come for the drinks.

9m9Ktfuo5uzbkzw6iovpWQ.text: Coughlin's Law could double as a funeral home. Pricey drinks, slow service, and silence combine to create an environment and experience similar to a war prison.  Save your money and drink literally at any other location on this earth and you're guaranteed a better time. Start the movement, #CloseCoughlinsLaw. Corn bread is ite tho.

XG1Gv1LII7p9GUuVPgkeBg.text: I went for their Sunday brunch and was happy to quickly get a table. The drinks were good especially the crushes.  However no one at my table enjoyed their entree. The only good part was the bacon lollipops.  I ordered the Huevos and was disappointed by the lack of flavor.  My eggs were underdone and brisket was dry.  Maybe they are still working the kinks out, but I will hold off on returning for now.

meJJyYyXN-1ooYDlJccOww.text: Definitely one of my favorite bar/restaurants in Pittsburgh, food is amazing, tons of beer. Staff is very knowledgeable and has a great vibe. I'll definitely be back!

_X9HOckqSPZw0GOTUrRh-A.text: Today was my second time here, but first time trying their food. Nice new place, great atmosphere, friendly staff, great service. However I did order their chicken BLT and I was NOT pleased to say the least. The plating was nice however the chicken was fried in a tempora batter that turned out to be extremely greasy and overcooked to the point where it was basically just hard fried tempora coating with no chicken inside. I did want to give it back and get the salad instead however, I didn't want to be "that" customer. The waitress did also spill the cucumber salad on me (which the salad was amazing, once they brought me a new one) however she was very nice and apologetic and I completely understood. It would have been nice to maybe have my drink taken off my bill etc for the mishap since it got all over me, but hey I'll let that slide. I would recommend to NOT get the chicken BLT especially since now I am not feeling well at all from the grease, however my friends had a salad (which was my first choice) and they said that was amazing. So overall yes I will go back but I just won't get that sandwich and hopefully no spills.
